docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: DEATH IS GRAY, AN ASHEN dusky gray. It comes as a fog, sometimes creeping in stealthily, other times dropping like a curtain. The eyes often register it first, drifting off to a distant horizon beyond mortal knowledge. Curiously, those who know death intimately will look not only in the eyes, but also at the fingernails.

byline.original: By Ralph Brauer; Ralph Brauer is an analyst with the Hubert Humphrey Institute of Public Affairs

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Spurned by both Albany and the City Council in his requests for tax increases to hire more police officers to fight drugs, Mayor Koch yesterday ordered nearly all city agencies to prepare to trim 1.5 percent from their current budgets as a way to finance his $110 million anti-drug plan.

headline.main: Koch Orders Agencies to Prepare Budget Cuts
